rules.text: Nudity and sexually explicit content is prohibited for accounts registered on this instance
Violent media must be marked as sensitive when posting
No racism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, xenophobia, or casteism
No incitement of violence or promotion of violent ideologies
No harassment, dogpiling or doxxing of other users
No content illegal in the United States, Germany, or Finland
Do not share intentionally false or misleading information
Bots must be marked as bots in their profile preferences, and automated posts should be unlisted (exceptions apply).
You must select the appropriate language for each post.
Do not spam or abuse network features.
Please read https://mpp.bus-hit.me for moderation information and best practices.

records.text: MousebustersI feel guilty saying I'm disappointed. Its a small indie dev, most of the game is free, and you can tell the team cares.The story is surface level and very on the nose. Outside two moments nothing hit me emotionally. The gameplay isn't challenging or interesting, and you are always told exactly where to tap. On the positive side I loved the art in this game. Strong consistent theming and well decorated environments. That alone will get me to check out the devs other games.

Strong consistent theming and well decorated environments. That alone will get me to check out the devs other games.
